x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Deaf and Hard of Hearing students often struggle to get high-quality, real-time sign language interpreters for their classes and school events. Scheduling interpreters is a chaotic, manual process involving many emails and phone calls, which leads to cancellations, delays, and poor learning experiences for students.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A smart platform that uses AI and mobile tools to make scheduling and deploying certified sign language interpreters as simple as requesting a ride-share:

  • Easy Request App: Teachers or students submit a request for an interpreter through a simple app (like a service catalog) with the time, date, and subject.
  • Smart Dispatch & Routing (FSM): The system automatically matches the request with the closest and most qualified interpreter available, optimizing their travel route (using Field Service Management tools) to save time and cost.
  • AI-Augmented Learning: Integrates with future AI tools to provide real-time, high-quality captions for virtual content, serving as a reliable backup or supplement to the live interpreter.
  • Confidential Case Management: All student and interpreter schedules are tracked in a secure system to ensure privacy and compliance.
